newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia says June Eurobond to be between 10-20 yrs.
newsitem.headline: Russia says June Eurobond to be between 10-20 yrs.

text.p: The next Russian Eurobond, to be placed in the second half of June, will have a tenor of between 10 and 20 years, a Finance Ministry spokeswoman quoted First Deputy Finance Minister Alexei Kudrin as saying.
"We are placing a long-term paper from 10 to 20 years," she said, quoting Kudrin.
Kudrin said most proceeds from the issue would be used to finance the budget deficit.
Russia's debut Eurobond, placed last November, had a tenor of five years. It was followed by a seven-year paper in March.
Russia will hold a road-show for its next Eurobond June 11-18.
